sections.title: Description
sections.raw_content: The Input.Flush procedure empties the keyboard buffer. It is often used to avoid accidentally reading multiple keystrokes because the user pressed a key for too long, causing autorepeat.
sections.mdown_content:
The **Input.Flush** procedure empties the keyboard buffer. It is often used to avoid accidentally reading multiple
keystrokes because the user pressed a key for too long, causing autorepeat.

sections.title: Example
code:
loop
            if hasch then
                put getchar ..
                Input.Flush
                delay (100)
            end if
        end loop
sections.raw_content: This program echoes input from the keyboard at a rate of 10 characters per second. If you hold down a key, the echoing will stop as soon as you stop pressing the key. Without the Input.Flush, the program continues to echo many more keystrokes that have accumulated in the keyboard buffer.

sections.title: Status
